titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: George W. Wagoner (1896-1957) graduated from the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine in 1922. Wagoner was an orthopedic surgeon at Philadelphia Orthopaedic Hospital and Infirmary for Nervous Diseases and the Hospital of the Graduate School of Medicine, University of Pennsylvania. He was elected Fellow of CPP in 1928. In 1936-1937 Wagoner participated in a study on the relationship between climate and polio. Wagoner was a member of the Philadelphia County Medical Society, the Pennsylvania State Medical Society, the American Medical Society, and other societies.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers and photographs of George W. Wagoner. Materials include: photographs, transparencies, and glass lantern slides of bones, bone sections, and x-rays; manuscripts and illustrations for articles; correspondence related to publication of articles; reprints by Wagoner and others, including a number of by F.W. Lang; a scrapbook of clippings about Wagoner; a scrapbook of comments and reviews on Wagoner's book, A Handbook of Experimental Pathology; several awards and certificates; temperature and weather charts and illustrations related to a study of polio; a photograph of a 1917 Philadelphia County Medical Society dinner; and a menu from of a 1911 banquet held by the Medical Club of Philadelphia for President Taft. The collection also includes several patient records, mostly from the 1920s.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Donated by Frieda Wagoner Woodruff
